central.translation[0].definitions[0].de: in the middle of an area or an object
central.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The roof is supported by a central column.
central.translation[0].definitions[1].de: used about the part of an organization, system etc which controls the rest of it, or its work
central.translation[0].definitions[2].de: more important and having more influence than anything else
central.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Owen played a central role in the negotiations.
His ideas were of central importance in the development of the theory.
Education has become a central issue in public debate.
values which are central to our society
central.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a place that is central is easy to reach because it is near the middle of a town or area
central.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: It’s very central, just five minutes’ walk from the main square.
central.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 3: more important and having more influence than anything else
central.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: a central role/part
The report emphasizes the central role of science in society.
a central issue
Education is a central issue for the government.
a central theme
What would you say is the central theme of the book?
a central figure
During this time he was a central figure in American politics.
a central feature
Cultural diversity is a central feature of modern British society.
be of central importance
Loving care is of central importance to a child’s development.
a central concern
Environmental problems are now a central concern.
a central idea
This was a central idea in Marxist theory.
a central argument
Let’s consider the central argument for reducing the voting age.
a central aspect
The spread of ideas is a central aspect of globalization.
central.translation[1].definitions[0].de: full of a particular type of thing or person
central.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: It was mosquito-central down by the river.
In the 1990s, London’s docklands became yuppie-central  (=full of rich young people).
